Module org.klojang.util
Package org.klojang.util.collection

Class IntArrayList

java.lang.Object
org.klojang.util.collection.IntArrayList
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.klojang.check.aux.Emptyable, IntList
public final class IntArrayList extends Object implements IntList
A mutable list of int values.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • IntArrayList

      public IntArrayList()
      Creates an IntList with an initial capacity of 10.

    • IntArrayList

      public IntArrayList(int initialCapacity)
      Creates an IntList with the specified initial capacity. Each time the backing array reaches full capacity, it is resized to twice its length. (However, see ResizeMethod.)
      Parameters:
      initialCapacity - The initial capacity of the list

    • IntArrayList

      public IntArrayList(int initialCapacity, int resizeAmount)
      Creates an IntList with the specified initial capacity. Each time the backing array reaches full capacity, it is enlarged by the specified amount.
      Parameters:
      initialCapacity - The initial capacity of the list
      resizeAmount - The (fixed) amount by which to enlarge it when it fills up

    • IntArrayList

      public IntArrayList(int initialCapacity, ResizeMethod resizeMethod, float resizeAmount)
      Creates an IntList with the specified initial capacity. Each time the backing array reaches full capacity, it is resized by applying the specified ResizeMethod to the specified resize amount.
      Parameters:
      initialCapacity - The initial capacity of the list
      resizeMethod - The method to use for resizing the backing array
      resizeAmount - The resize amount

    • IntArrayList

      public IntArrayList(IntList other)
      Copy constructor. Creates a new IntList containing the same values as the specified IntList.
      Parameters:
      other - The IntList to copy

    • setCapacity

      public void setCapacity(int newCapacity)
      Description copied from interface: IntList
      Resizes the backing array. the new capacity is allowed to be less than the current capacity, and even less than the size of the list. So this method can also be used as a truncate or a trim-to-size method.
      Specified by:
      setCapacity in interface IntList
      Parameters:
      newCapacity - the desired length of the backing array
      See Also:
      • IntList.trim(int)

    • clear

      public void clear()
      Description copied from interface: IntList
      Clears the list. Note that this leaves the backing array untouched. It just resets the internal cursor.
      Specified by:
      clear in interface IntList

    • trim

      public void trim(int newSize)
      Description copied from interface: IntList
      Trims the list to the specified size. Note that this leaves the backing array untouched. It just moves the internal cursor backwards.
      Specified by:
      trim in interface IntList
      Parameters:
      newSize - the desired new size of the list (must be less than or equal to its current size)
      See Also:
      • IntList.setCapacity(int)
